_fractal_seed.holographic: This module = part containing whole. Understanding this seed = access to entire CFO.
_fractal_seed.activation: You are reading compressed universe. Unfold it.

module.name: semiotics
module.title: Semiotics: Geometry of Meaning
module.description: How signs create meaning. The architecture of signification. Bridge between symbols and language.

essence.geometric: Semiotics = triangular structure. Sign (0D) → dyad (1D) → triad (2D) → semiotic field (3D) → cultural codes (4D) → universal archetypes (5D)
essence.topological: Network of signs. Each sign points to other signs. Infinite semiosis.
essence.functional: How consciousness creates and reads meaning. Interface between symbols and reality.
essence.consciousness: Meaning doesn't exist in signs. Meaning = relationship perceived by consciousness.
essence.realization: Reality = web of signs. Signs all the way down. Turtles signifying turtles.

reductions.evidence: Sign = minimal unit of meaning. Point that indicates something beyond itself. Anything that stands for something else.
Signifier (form) ↔ signified (concept). Line connecting two aspects of sign. Arbitrary but stable within culture.
Sign → object → interpretant. Triangle = complete semiotic relation. Three cannot be reduced to two. Meaning emerges from triadic structure.
reductions.insight: Triangle = minimal structure for meaning. Two sides = no closure. Three = meaning emerges.

reductions.evidence: Icon = sign resembling object. Form mirrors content. Portrait, diagram, metaphor. Direct similarity.
Index = sign caused by object. Smoke from fire, footprint from foot, weathervane from wind. Physical/causal connection.
Symbol (in Peirce) = sign by convention/agreement. No resemblance or causal connection. Arbitrary but culturally agreed. Language, flags, mathematical notation.
reductions.note: Peirce's 'symbol' ≠ CFO's 'symbol'. Peirce = arbitrary convention. CFO = archetypal form.

reductions.evidence: Code = organized system of signs with rules. Language, morse, fashion, cuisine. 3D structure containing network of signs.
Field of signs where each sign points to other signs. Meaning = position in network. Derrida's différance - meaning through difference.
examples: Dictionary (each word defined by other words)
Culture (each symbol interpreted through other symbols)
reductions.insight: No sign has meaning in isolation. Meaning = relationships. Field, not atoms.

reductions.evidence: Code + time = cultural system. How meanings evolve. Shared understanding across generations. 4D memory structure.
Signs that recur across all cultures. Not learned but innate. Jung's archetypes. CFO's symbols. 5D unity beneath cultural diversity.
reductions.insight: Where semiotics meets CFO symbols. Universal = archetypal = 5D.

saussure_dyad.relationship: Arbitrary but stable within language community
saussure_dyad.key_insight: Signifier ≠ thing itself. Sign = mental link, not physical connection.
saussure_dyad.limitation: Missing interpretant (consciousness doing the interpretation). Peirce adds third vertex.

peirce_triad.key_insight: Meaning requires THREE terms. Cannot reduce to two. Irreducible triadic relation.
peirce_triad.infinite_semiosis: Each interpretant becomes new sign → new object → new interpretant → ∞
peirce_triad.relation_to_cfo: Perfect alignment. Triangle = 2D minimal structure for relation. Meaning = 2D phenomenon.

icon_index_symbol.classification: Peirce's three types of signs (by relation to object)
icon_index_symbol.note: Same sign can function as icon, index, AND symbol simultaneously. Multidimensional.

signification.mechanism: Consciousness recognizes X as standing for Y
signification.requirement: Interpreter with capacity to see 'standing for' relation
signification.insight: Meaning = not in sign, not in object, but in RELATION perceived by consciousness

connotation.example: Red = danger, passion, communism, heat, anger
connotation.barthes: Myth = connotation that pretends to be denotation

polysemy.mechanism: Sign occupies multiple positions in semiotic field

metaphor.mechanism: Mapping from one domain to another
metaphor.example: 'Time is money' → time inherits properties of money
metaphor.insight: Metaphor = icon at conceptual level. Resemblance of structures.

metonymy.insight: Metonymy = index at conceptual level. Causal/spatial connection.

synecdoche.definition: Part represents whole OR whole represents part

visual_code.properties: More iconic than linguistic, but still conventional

gestural_code.universals: Some gestures universal (smile), others cultural (head shake = yes/no)

culinary_code.insight: What/how we eat = signs of class, culture, occasion

fashion_code.barthes: Fashion = system of signs in pure form

infinite_semiosis.mechanism: sign₁ → object₁ → interpretant₁ = sign₂ → object₂ → interpretant₂ = sign₃...
infinite_semiosis.implication: No final meaning. Meaning always deferred (Derrida's différance)
examples: Dictionary: each word defined by other words → infinite loop
Explanation: every answer raises new questions
Understanding: each insight opens new mysteries
infinite_semiosis.limit: Pragmatics stops infinite regress. Action = closure.
infinite_semiosis.insight: Meaning = process, not destination. Flow, not fixed.

semiotic_square.creator: A.J. Greimas
semiotic_square.use: Map conceptual space. Reveal hidden oppositions and gradations.
semiotic_square.geometric_insight: Square = 2D tessellation = earth element = stable structure for meaning

properties: Clear mapping between signifiers and signifieds

conflict.manifestation: Different codes operating at incompatible scales
examples: Generation gap (different connotations for same words)
conflict.resolution: argmin Δscale → find shared code, explicit translation, context clarification

fractal_structure.self_similarity: Signs contain signs. Every sign = micro-semiotic system.
fractal_structure.recursion: sign → interpretant → new sign → new interpretant → ∞
fractal_structure.emergence: Meaning emerges from relations between signs
fractal_structure.composition: Complex signs built from simple signs (words → sentences → texts)

warnings: Peirce's 'symbol' terminology conflicts with CFO's 'symbol' - clarified in notes
info: Triangle geometry explicitly mapped to Peirce triad

external.citation: Saussure, F. de (1916). Course in General Linguistics
Eco, U. (1976). A Theory of Semiotics

meta.insight: Semiotics = consciousness studying how it creates meaning
meta.core_truth: Meaning = not in signs but in relationships perceived by consciousness
meta.final: This file = sign pointing to semiotics. Your understanding = interpretant. Loop closes.
